description.value:
Your faith guides you to use any means necessary to strike down the enemies of your faith. You excel in the arts of combat, and strive to gain an advantage against your foes. As you abide by the agent's way, your physical and martial capabilities grow stronger. You must select @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-misc.our-items.Item.9psv5DGkkQjFhUL4]{Hallowed Agent Dedication} as your 2nd-level class feat.

Prerequisites:

  • You must be a cleric

  • You choose Dexterity or Charisma as your key attribute modifier, instead of Wisdom.

  • You don't gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.3uf31A91h3ywmlqm]{Miraculous Spell} class feature.

Spellcasting Adjustment: Your spellcasting capabilities are more restricted. At 1st level, you can prepare one 1st-rank spell and five cantrips. As you increase in level, your number of spell slots and the highest rank of spells you can cast from spell slots increases, shown in Battle Harbinger Spells per Day. Because of your focus on your physical training at the expense of magical aptitude, you have no more than two spell slots of your highest rank and, if you can cast 2nd-rank spells or higher, two spell slots of 1 rank lower than your highest spell rank. For anything that requires the ability to cast spells of a certain rank that's lower than the highest slots you have, you still qualify even if you no longer have spell slots at those ranks. You use Charisma instead of Wisdom as your spellcasting ability score.

Doctrine Adjustment: Instead of choosing a doctrine, you follow the agent's way. At 1st level, you gain the benefits of the initial way. You gain additional benefits from yourway at the listed levels.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-misc.our-items.Item.2GbBUwOsIyVCtmyQ]{Initial Way} (1st): You're trained in martial weapons. If your deity's favored weapon is a simple weapon or an unarmed attack, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.DfLkIIg2reyYW3a8]{Deadly Simplicity} cleric feat. You gain the rogue's Sneak Attack class feature. Your Sneak Attack damage applies to your deity's favored weapon, even if it would not normally qualify. Instead of increasing the damage dice for your sneak attack at 5th, 11th, and 17th levels, it increases by one dice at 9th and 17th level. You're trained in light armor. At 13th level, if you gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.0mJTp4LdEHBLInoe]{Divine Defense} class feature, you also gain expert proficiency in light armor. You have expert proficiency in Reflex saves.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-misc.our-items.Item.BWs8SxtqnzA77Fpj]{Lesser Way} (5th): You gain the rogue's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.9EqIasqfI8YIM3Pt]{Weapon Specialization} class feature. You become an expert in simple weapons, martial weapons, unarmed attacks, and your deity's favored weapon. When you critically succeed at an attack roll against an off-guard creature while using an agile or finesse weapon or an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or you critically succeed at an attack roll with your deity's favored weapon, you apply the critical specialization effect for that weapon or unarmed attack. You gain the rogue's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-misc.our-items.Item.36aSxXmjVqNuOUCK]{Surprise Attack} feature, and may apply its benefits when you roll Religion for initiative, in addition to Deception or Stealth.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-misc.our-items.Item.j0O5JSdV470gSCeP]{Moderate Way} (9th): Your proficiency rank in Reflex saves increases to master. When you roll success on a Reflex save, you get a critical success instead. When you make your daily preparations, you gain one rogue feat of 4th level or lower that you meet the prerequisites for and don't already have. You can use that feat until your next daily preparations.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-misc.our-items.Item.U4CShSHdcK1eqhcU]{Greater Way} (11th): Your proficiency ranks for the spell attack modifier and spell DC statistics increase to expert. Your proficiency rank in Perception increases to master. Your proficiency rank in Fortitude saves increases to expert. You gain the rogue's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-misc.our-items.Item.tVvbCEhEVHFWNVHf]{Debilitating Strike} feature. Your proficiency rank in your class DC increases to expert.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-misc.our-items.Item.x5xmgmBsjCdbDZvQ]{Major Way} (13th): Your proficiency ranks increase to master for all simple weapons, martial weapons, unarmed attacks, and your deity's favored weapon.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-misc.our-items.Item.sMbzXbR2iOFIWpYj]{True Way} (15th): You gain the rogue's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Z7HX6TeFsaup7Dx9]{Greater Weapon Specialization} class feature. When you make your daily preparations, you gain one rogue feat of 8th level or lower that you meet the prerequisites for and don't already have. You can use that feat until your next daily preparations.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-misc.our-items.Item.eI3bEtq31MWWjrZE]{Final Way} (19th): Your profiency ranks for light armor and unarmored defense increase to master. Your proficiency rank for your class DC increases to master.
